{{also|Liegen}} ==Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nl|dum|liegen}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|liegan}}, from {{inh|nl|gem-pro|*leuganÄ…}}, from {{der|nl|ine-pro|*lewgÊ°-}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/Ëˆli.É£É™(n)/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-liegen.ogg|Audio}} * {{hyphenation|nl|lie|gen}} * {{rhymes|nl|iÉ£É™n}} ===Verb=== {{nl-verb}} # {{lb|nl|intransitive}} to [[lie]] {{gloss|to tell lies}} ====Inflection==== {{nl-conj-st|class=2|lieg|loog|logen|5=loge}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|nl|liegbeest}} * {{l|nl|voorliegen}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|nl|leugen}} * {{l|nl|leugenaar}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|af|lieg}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|ligen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|ligen}}, from older {{m|goh|liggen}} by generalisation of the stem of the 2nd and 3rd persons singular, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*ligjanÄ…}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*legÊ°-}}. Compare {{cog|nds|liggen}}, {{cog|nl|liggen}}, {{cog|en|lie}}, {{cog|da|ligge}}, {{cog|got|ğŒ»ğŒ¹ğŒ²ğŒ°ğŒ½}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ËˆliËÉ¡É™n/|[ËˆliËÉ¡É™n]|[ËˆliËÉ¡Å‹Ì]}} * {{audio|de|De-liegen.ogg|audio}} * {{hyphenation|de|lie|gen}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=5|liegt|lag|gelegen|past subjunctive=lÃ¤ge|auxiliary=both}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[lie]] {{gloss|to be in a horizontal position}} ## {{lb|de|Swiss}} to [[lie down]] # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[be]], to [[lie]] somewhere (of flat objects, also of inpatients in a hospital; otherwise use {{m|de|sitzen}} or {{m|de|stehen}}) # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to be [[located]], to [[lie]] somewhere (of countries, towns, houses, etc.) # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[be]], to [[stand]] (of indices, measurements) #* '''2012''' June 19, ''{{w|Die Welt}}'' [http://epaper.apps.welt.de/welt/archiv/], page 10: #*: Der deutsche Energieverbrauch '''lag''' in den ersten drei Monaten des Jahres rund zwei Prozent unter dem Niveau des Vorjahreszeitraumes. #*:: In the first three months of the year, the German energy consumption was about two percent below the level of the same period last year. ====Usage notes==== * The commonest auxiliary with {{m|de||liegen}} is {{m|de|haben}}: ''Ich habe gelegen.'' In northern and central Germany, this form is strongly predominant and in some regions exclusive. In southern Germany, Austria, and Switzerland, {{m|de|sein}} is usual in the vernacular and also, alternatively, in standard usage: ''Ich bin gelegen.'' ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|lieg|lag|gelegen|hs|||lÃ¤g|a}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de |anliegen |aufliegen |daliegen |darniederliegen |durchliegen |einliegen |erliegen |freiliegen |herumliegen |liegenlassen |obliegen |querliegen |Ã¼berliegen |unterliegen |vorliegen |zurÃ¼ckliegen }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dum|odt|liegan}}, from {{inh|dum|gem-pro|*leuganÄ…}}, from {{der|dum|ine-pro|*lewgÊ°-}}. ===Verb=== {{dum-verb}} # {{lb|dum|intransitive}} to [[lie]] {{gloss|to tell lies}} ====Inflection==== {{dum-conj-st|class=2|lieg|lÃ´g|lÅg|lÅg}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|nl|liegen}} * {{desc|li|lege}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:VMNW|ID83603|lieghen|II}} * {{R:MNW|26140}}
